deck: Bringing back the Marvel UK heroes!
description:
An eight-part limited series of one-shots that brings back some of the heroes and characters who had been introduced by Marvel UK in the mid-1990s.

Reading Order

  • Revolutionary War: Alpha (written by Andy Lanning & Alan Cowsill and drawn by Richard Elson)
  • Revolutionary War: Dark Angel (written by Kieron Gillen and drawn by Dietrich O. Smith)
  • Revolutionary War: Knights of Pendragon (written by Rob Williams and drawn by Will Sliney)
  • Revolutionary War: Death's Head II (written by Andy Lanning & Alan Cowsill and drawn by Nick Roche)
  • Revolutionary War: Supersoldiers (written by Rob Williams and drawn by Brent Eric Anderson and Tom Palmer)
  • Revolutionary War: Motormouth (written by Glenn Dakin and drawn by Ronan Cliquet)
  • Revolutionary War: Warheads (written by Andy Lanning & Alan Cowsill and drawn by Gary Erskine)
  • Revolutionary War: Omega (written by Andy Lanning & Alan Cowsill and drawn by Richard Elson)

Collected Editions

  • Revolutionary War

deck: Story arc based on the Tv series three part story "Sparkwar".
description:
The Strike

Plot

After rescuing a fleeing Cheetor from a Vehicon horde the Maximals encounter Thrust, a Vehicon general. During the battle between Thrust and Rattrap, Rattrap attaches a EMP device to him. After the battle Rattrap is seen collecting parts from fallen Vehicons, which he gives to Botanica to study. When Thrust returns to Megatron,Thrust gets chewed out by Megatron for failing to hold the Maximals at bay. Megatron reveals two new Generals to his army, Obsidian and Strika. While meditating Optimus Primal receives a vision about the sparks Megatron absorbed.

During a midnight flight session Nightscream and Silverbolt get ambushed by the new Vehicon generals. After calling for Maximal reinforcements it appears that the Maximals have defeated the new Generals, they escape. Maximals decide to follow them to see if they can convince them to change sides. Meanwhile back at the Maximal base Botanica continues to create more organic life through green organic matter, which backfires allowing her to see a vision of what will happen to the lost sparks.

After cornering the fleeing Vehicon Generals, they discover that it was a trap that they were lured into, Obsidian mocks primal by saying "Never underestimate your enemies". After the tides where turned by the new Generals the Maximals flee to their base while being chased down by Vehicons.

During Botanica's vision she see's what happend when Cybertron was taken over by Megatron and his Vehicons. Primal decides to hold up in the old Citadel, only to released they where being herded there, Obsidian reveals his and Strika's identities to the Maximals, The Greatest Cybertronian generals. Now trapped the Maximals defend themselves form the Vehicon hordes, Massively outnumbered they have no choice but to fight, Only to be rescued by Botanica, who highhandedly defeated the Vehicon hordes and escaped back to their base. After reporting their failures to Megatron he reveals what he has planned for the captured sparks.

The Search

Plot

Cybertron is being searched by Megatrons new Vehicon drones, as the Maximals travel the sewer systems. After heading to the surface they observe the Vehicons fortifying Megatron's location, while discussing what to do Primal has a vision about the sparks, Primal states that Megatron has recently moved them. Megatron directes his generals to three locations to destroy all Maximals but Primal. Meanwhile, Blackarachnia wishes she could travel in robot form with the Vehicons detecting them, Rattrap reveals that he's been working on a Scrambling device so they can travel without being detected, upon which everyone gets annoyed on him not telling them sooner, but he's not sure if they will work.

After agreeing to try the Scramblers they transform just as Obsidian flies over them without noticing them. Primal splits the team up so they can find the sparks he saw in his vision, Cheetor, Blackarachina and Silverbolt are sent to a processing plant, Silverbolt dislikes Cheetor giving him orders only to be interrupted by Blackarachina stating a lot has changed since the Beast Wars. Meanwhile Primal and Nightscream search the sewers and come across signs of Nightscreams friend Noble, he asks if they can search for him but Optimus states that they must focus on the task at hand, they come a dead end and Primal decides for them to go further down.

Rattrap and Botanica arrive at the outskirts of the Citadel constantly bickering about Primal's choice for teaming them up. After Rattrap picks up traces up Sparks they arrive only to find empty canisters, after leaving the canisters they are ambushed buy Strika and her Vehicon drones, Botanica states that the scramblers don't work followed by Rattrap screaming run away.

At the same time at the Processing Plant Silverbolt, Cheetor and Blackarachina are ambushed by Obsidian and his Vehicon drones, Defying orders from Cheetor, Silverbolt jumps straight back into the ambush to fight back. Meanwhile Primal and Nightscream come across an abandoned city which is revealed to be Iacon. While traveling through Iacon they stumble upon a holographic tribute of Optimus Prime.

Rattrap and Botanica decide to revert back to beast mode and duck into a convenient building just as Strika passes by, upon entering the build Rattraps attention is distracted by the buildings contents: Holographic pleasure chips. He decides to take some of them just as he notices the chips player, he plugs himself in just as Strika attacks Botanica. Back at the Processing plant Silverbolt gets shot and falls back to his team only to be criticized by Cheetor about his recklessness.

Just as Primal and Nightscream decide to move on the holographic image moves and picks Primal up leaving him in a trance, Just as thrust attacks. With Rattrap still lost in his fantasy world Botanica is giving no choice but to pull the machine's plug just as a blast scatters them, Rattrap tells Botanica to keep Strika busy.

As leader of his team Cheetor decides that they must retreat. Back at Iacon Nightscream fights Thrust and his Vehicons while defending Primal, inside Primal's head he is talking to the original Optimus asking him for guidance about what to do about the sparks, but Prime suddenly starts to laugh which deepens to Megatron's voice, the holographic image of Optimus is replaced with Megatron!

Strika threatens to kill Botanica, when rattrap notices she's in range of the holo-player, he jumps onto her and plugs a Holo-chip into her head, saving Botanica. Meanwhile at the Plant Silverbolt find a power core which Cheetor uses to blow up Obsidian and his drones. Megatron reveals that he sent Primal the vision of the Sparks, so he could lure him to Iacon take to the last bit of information from Primal needed to decipher the Oracles secrets, upon taking the information Optimus awakens from his trance.

As Nightscream is fighting for his life he gets shot by Thrust, just as Thrust is about to finish of Nightscream, Noble arrives and saves his life, after seeing Nightscream saved by Noble, Primal states they have to meet back up with the other Maximals. Optimus reveals to his team that their mission was a trick, but he now knows where the Sparks truly are.
name: Sparkwar

description:
Grave New World introduces Captain Barnes and his naval crew of survivors. In the opening sequence, Barnes discovers clues about the nature of the Crossed infection which help him to develop a code of conduct for his followers. Using what he feels are lessons learned about the infected, he sets his ultimate plan for riding out the storm and creating a new functioning faction of society. But something isn't quite right about the captain or his crew. And survivors who find themselves among his flock soon find out that safety comes at a price. This new chapter in the Crossed mythology begins in the early days of the breakout and spans the length of the plague.

This story arc is collected in the Crossed 9 trade paperback.

deck: Following a confrontation with Doomsday, Superman becomes infected by spores that slowly turn him into the new Doomsday, and it's up to his friends and allies to try and reverse the change before it's too late.
description:
Overview

Superman: Doomed took place in the spring/summer of 2014 within most of DC Comics' Superman books, spearheaded by writers Greg Pak and Charles Soule. Writer Scott Lobdell contributed early to the crossover, but due to his leaving Superman in June, he contributed nothing towards the story afterwards.

Reading Order

The bulk of the Doomed crossover takes place between Action Comics and Superman/Wonder Woman, but also spills into single issues of other series as well as annuals. The crossover is bookended by two special over-sized issues of Superman: Doomed.

April (Prologue)

  • Action Comics #30
  • Superman/Wonder Woman #7
  • Superman #30

May (Infected)

  • Superman: Doomed #1
  • Action Comics #31
  • Superman/Wonder Woman #8
  • Batman/Superman #11
  • Superman #31

June (Enemy of the State)

  • Action Comics #32
  • Superman/Wonder Woman #9

July/August (Superdoom)

  • Action Comics #33
  • Superman/Wonder Woman #10
  • Superman/Wonder Woman Annual #1
  • Action Comics Annual #3

August (Last Sun)

  • Action Comics #34 - Last Sun, Chapter 1: Assimilation
  • Superman/Wonder Woman #11
  • Supergirl #34
  • Superman: Doomed #2

Non-U.S. Editions

  • Superman #30 (German)
  • Superman #31 (German)
  • Superman #32 (German)
  • Superman: Doomed Special #1 (German)
  • Superman #33 (German)
  • Superman #34 (German)
  • Superman: Doomed Special #2 (German)
  • Superman #35 (German)
